DataElement.preferredDefinition: The method used to document surgical procedure details.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Surgical Procedure Document Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-11; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The name that describes the method of collecting, abstracting, and coding of printed or written information for future reference.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures. (dictionary.com)

Concepts.definition: A chronological written account of a patient's examination and treatment that includes the patient's medical history and complaints, the physician's physical findings, the results of diagnostic tests and procedures, and medications and therapeutic procedures.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The storing or preserving of video images to be displayed later.

Concepts.definition: The storing or preserving of video images to be displayed later.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The collecting, abstracting, and coding of printed or written information for future reference.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Printed or written information for future reference.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 3123112 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.

DataElement.changeDescription: Created for CDISC aligned NCI Standard CRF task. ghd
DataElement.administrativeNotes: 02.13.23_Set Reg Status to Standard for all CDISC Aligned content_ghd
